issues.description: The template repository's Main.java includes commented example instantiations of Seal, Pig, and Goat using two-argument constructors (e.g. new Seal("Clarabelle", "marine")). However, the problem statement/UML and the solution code define animals with a single attribute (name) and single-argument constructors (e.g. Seal(String name)). This discrepancy can confuse students about the required constructor signatures and whether additional attributes (like habitat/type) must be implemented.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the template examples consistent with the UML/problem statement and solution. Either (A) update template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Main.java to use single-argument constructors (e.g. new Seal("Clarabelle"), new Pig("Doodle"), new Goat("Buttinsky")), or (B) if a second attribute was intended, update the problem statement/UML and the solution classes to include that attribute and corresponding two-argument constructors. Option A is recommended to match the current UML/specification and solution.
